title: max_brass
body:
[i][[arms_(game)|ARMS]][/i] character.

An ARMS veteran, champion and head of the ARMS League and the organizer of the Grand Prix who wears a combination of the [[mask]] and a fist [[helmet]]. When charged or successfully performing a throw attack, he can increase his muscles, therefore his punches are permanently changed and resisting knockdown. He also shares [[spring_man_(arms)|Spring Man's]] comeback ability. When his health is low, he will gain super armor and double the attack to even out his opponents.

His primary ARMS are the [[nade_(arms)|Nade]], the [[roaster_(arms)|Roaster]], and the [[kablammer_(arms)|Kablammer]]. His home stage is Sky Arena.

h4. External Links
* "Official Profile (JP)":https://www.nintendo.co.jp/switch/aabqa/fighter/11/index.html
* "Unofficial Profile (EN)":https://armswiki.org/wiki/Max_Brass

title: mitsurugi_heishirou
body:
Character in the [[SoulCalibur|Soul]] series of fighting games. He is a mainstay of the SoulCalibur series and one of most iconic characters in the franchise.

Heishiro was born the fourth son of a farmer in Bizen, Japan; but after many years of seeing his homeland ravaged by war, he decided to become a samurai. After his parents' death in his 14th year, he took a sword and the last name Mitsurugi. He went to train under the powerful warlord of the Murakami clan. At this time, Japan was in the middle of the Sengoku Jidai or "the age of the country at war" in which the feudal lords or "daimyos" attempted to claim the title of Shogun. 

Mitsurugi was a powerful force on the battlefield, and rumors of him spread like wildfire, heralding him as the warrior that could mow down foes like fields of wheat. He received numerous military commendations and eventually reached the rank of commissioned officer in the Japanese armed forces. But all along, his only true desire was a worthy opponent.

title: meat_day
body:
A [[date pun]] for the Japanese word [i]niku[/i] (肉) "meat". It can be on the 29th of any month, or on February 9th (2/9), as the digits 2/9 are "ni"/"ku" in Japanese.

Meat is a euphemism for "excess flesh" in Japanese, and eating red meat is likewise depicted as an easy way to get fat quickly, so pictures of [[curvy]], [[plump]], and [[fat]] girls start appearing on these days in greater numbers, sometimes alongside actual [[meat]].

Alternatively, some artists consider "meat day" as a celebration of characters [i]with[/i] meat, in other words, [[muscular]].

h4. See Also
* [[good meat day]]
* [[date pun]]

title: balus
body:
"Balus" or ("Balse") is a spell cast in the final scene of [[Tenkuu no Shiro Laputa]]. The phrase is a [[meme]] among Japanese internet users, who spam the phrase every year during the annual broadcast of the film on Japanese television. During the 2014 broadcast, the phrase was reportedly spammed on Twitter more than 140,000 times per second.

title: saucepan
body: A piece of cookware, usually round and made of metal, with a high rim and a long handle. The high sides of a saucepan serve two purposes. The first and obvious purpose is that these high walls allow more food and drink to fit inside the pan. The second, less obvious purpose is that they give the pan a larger surface area, which when paired with their smaller base means that the saucepan can heat their contents more evenly by surrounding them on all sides. Saucepans are taller than stock pots relative to their width for this very reason.

title: uss_antietam_(cv-36)_(y.ssanoha)
body:
CV-36. 
A [[Personification]] character based on America's Essex-class Aircraft Carrier [b]USS Antietam[/b]. An original creation of artist [[y.ssanoha]], based on [[Essex (Warship Girls R)]]'s design.


Like all Essex-class, she wears a black suit with white mini-skirt and red breast plate, carries a black flight deck marked with her hull number, and usually has an expressionless face with flat gaze. She has short hair with exposed forehead, and a line of red face paint under her right eye.

title: knit_hat
body: Hats originally made of wool (although nowadays they are usually made of synthetic fibers) intended to provide warmth in cold weather. Typically, knitted caps have simple, tapered structures, but there are many variants. Historically, wool knitted hats were an extremely common form of headwear for seamen, fishermen, hunters, and others who spent their working days outdoors from the 18th century onwards, and are still commonly used for this purpose in the northern parts of North America, Europe, Asia and other cold regions of the world.

title: dirk
body:
A dirk is a long thrusting [[dagger]]. Historically, it was a personal weapon of officers engaged in naval hand-to-hand combat during the Age of Sail as well as the personal sidearm of Highlanders. It was also used by the officers, pipers, and drummers of Scottish Highland regiments around 1800 and by Japanese naval officers.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Dirk":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dirk]

title: yuno_(hidamari_sketch)
body:
Yuno (sometimes called "Yunocchi" by [[Miyako (hidamari sketch)|]]) is a young girl and main character in [[Hidamari Sketch]].

She lives in the Sunshine Apartments, along with her close friends and neighbors [[Miyako (hidamari sketch)|]], [[Hiro (hidamari sketch)|]], and [[Sae (hidamari sketch)|]]. Her friends think of her as a very nice person. Yuno dreams of being a great artist someday. Although she is a skilled artist overall, she considers painting and drawing her specialties. She rarely takes off a pair of [[x hair ornament|X-shaped black hairpins]].

title: momotarou_dentetsu
body:
Momotaro Dentetsu is a long-running board game-style video game series in Japan; in which players travel by rail, ship, and airplane; attempting to acquire wealth through business transactions by buying properties; and dealing with rival entrepreneurs and nemeses such as the God of Poverty.

It's a spin-off of [[Momotarou Densetsu]] (though more popular than it) and features some characters from the series such as [[Momotarou_(momotarou_densetsu)|]] and [[Yashahime_(momotarou_densetsu)|]].
It also has its own characters like [[King Bonbii]], the aforementioned poverty god who takes many forms.

The game series has been very successful with nearly 20 entries and continued even after [[Hudson]] was acquired by [[Konami]], and managing to sell over a million copies since.

title: lazy_dungeon_master
body:
An [[isekai]] light novel.

h4. Synopsis

Being summoned into another world, Kami-sama heard his only condition when Masuda Keima answered that. … However, it still seemed that his offer wasn’t tempting. Amazed, Kami-sama saw him off saying, “I’ll hope for the next person,” and Keima was summoned as he was.

A blonde-haired girl calling herself Dungeon Core No. 695 summoned him. Though he then became the dungeon master by going with the flow, wait, this dungeon only has one room and is occupied by bandits…?

Can Keima overcome this sudden checkmate situation and obtain a life where he can indulge in his laziness while not working at all!?

h4. External links

* "Official website (JP)":http://over-lap.co.jp/narou/865541182/
* "Official English localisation":https://j-novel.club/s/lazy-dungeon-master

title: hyakuren_no_haou_to_seiyaku_no_valkyria
body:
A Japanese light novel series written by Seiichi Takayama and illustrated by [[Yukichin]].

Some urban legends are best left untested! [[Suou Yuuto]] gets more than he bargained for when he joins his childhood friend [[Mizuki Shimoya]] in testing out an urban legend. When he uses his [[phone]] to take a picture of himself with the local shrine's divine mirror, he is whisked off into another world—one heavily steeped in the lore of the old Norse myths.

Using his knowledge gained from school and from his solar-powered [[smartphone]], he has the chance to bring the Wolf Clan, the same people who cared for him, to prominence, all while earning the adoration of a group of magic-wielding warrior maidens known as the Einherjar.
other_names: 百錬の覇王と聖約の戦乙女

title: seras_victoria
body: [b]Seras Victoria[/b] is a newcomer to the [[Hellsing]] Organization. A former policewoman who was sired as a vampire by [[Alucard (Hellsing)|Alucard]] himself after being grievously wounded in a run-in with a vampire and his ghouls that killed her fellow officers, Seras is the second vampiric agent employed by [[Integra Hellsing]], and Alucard's partner on the hunt.
other_names: セラス・ヴィクトリア

title: integra_hellsing
body: [b]Sir Integra Fairbrook Wingates Hellsing[/b] is the leader of the [[Hellsing]] Organization and the current master of [[Alucard (Hellsing)|]]. A descendant of the original Van Helsing, Integra is dedicated to stopping the creatures of the night, but unlike the Iscariot Organization, she is not above using powerful vampires like Alucard and [[Seras Victoria]] to stop them.
other_names: インテグラル・ファルブルケ・ウィンゲーツ・ヘルシング

title: alucard_(hellsing)
body: [b]Alucard[/b] is the deadliest agent of the Church of England's [[Hellsing]] Organization and one of the most powerful vampires in existence. He is completely loyal to [[Integra Hellsing]], whom he calls his "Master", and is utterly merciless against her enemies. While he primarily uses two powerful guns, the [[Casull_(Hellsing)|Casull]] and the [[Jackal_(Hellsing)|Jackal]], against normal enemies, more powerful enemies will see him releasing one or more levels of his Control Art Restriction system, which act as a limiter to his immense amount of power as a vampire.

title: alexander_anderson
body: A vampire hunter from the [[Hellsing]] series, and the deadliest agent of the Iscariot Organization, a top-secret order of hunters backed by the Vatican. Anderson is [[Alucard (Hellsing)|]]'s deadliest rival, and possesses a powerful technological healing factor as well as numerous holy bayonets that have the ability to cancel out vampiric healing factors.
other_names: アレクサンド・アンデルセン

title: casull_(hellsing)
body: The Hellsing Arms 454 Casull is one of two guns used personally by [[Alucard (Hellsing)|Alucard]]. It is a powerful semiautomatic pistol chambered in .454 Casull with a silver finish. It is far too powerful for a normal human to wield one-handed, but for a vampire like Alucard, it is an ideal weapon for dealing with regular vampires and other creatures of the night.

Its cover has found itself associated with another of her songs, Plastic Love, due to its use in the thumbnail of the video starring it that went viral.

title: maidy_maidy
body:
Defacto official [[Final Fantasy XIV]] character of the original [i]Dad of Light[/i] author. 
On 10th December 2020 the official FFXIV Twitter (JP) posted regarding his passing.

h5. Dad of Light
Akio Inaba attempts to rekindle his bond with his retired and distant father Hirotaro through [[Final Fantasy XIV]]. Akio's plan is to connect with his father in-game and that it will expand into the real world.

The eight part mini-series was adapted from the original blog posts. It has also been adapted into a 2019 move titled [i]Brave Father Online[/i].

h4. External Links
Blog: "Ichigeki Kakusatsu SS Nikki":http://sumimarudan.blog7.fc2.com/blog-entry-2019.html
Wikipedia: "Dad of Light":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Final_Fantasy_XIV:_Dad_of_Light
"Official message from FFXIV Producer/Director Yoshida Naoki (EN, 12 December 2020)":https://na.finalfantasyxiv.com/blog/003072.html

title: strap
body: A long, thin flap or [[ribbon]], usually made of fabric or [[leather]]. Narrow straps are used as part of [[clothes|clothing]] and [[luggage]], [[sleeping bag]]s and other [[bed]]ding. See, for example, [[spaghetti strap]]s, [[shoulder strap]]s, etc. Straps differ from [[belt]]s primarily in that straps are usually integrated with items of clothing, unlike belts. Both can be used in combination with a [[buckle]].

title: scavenger_hunt
body:
A scavenger hunt is a game in which the organizers prepare a list defining specific items, which the participants seek to gather or complete all items on the list. In Japanese culture, they are often featured as part of a school's [[sports festival]]. The Japanese version is often a timed race (sometimes also [[relay_race|relay]] or [[obstacle race]]) and usually only features one item on the list per participant.

h4. See Also

* [[obstacle race]]
* [[relay race]]
* [[sports festival]]

title: nautilus_(animal)
body: A mollusk characterized by involute or more or less convolute shells that are generally smooth, with compressed or depressed whorl sections, straight to sinuous sutures, and a tubular, generally central siphuncle. Having survived relatively unchanged for hundreds of millions of years, nautiluses represent the only living members of the subclass nautiloidea, and are often considered "living fossils".

title: glitch_censor
body:
Using a [[glitch]] in order to censor content.  Often appears as garbled, blanked out, blocky pixels over the region being censored or by means of something being programmatically rendered (like an error message) obscuring the view.

It appears in:
* [[Ueno-san wa Bukiyou]] especially with the character [[Kitanaga]]
* [[Dennou Coil]] especially with the character [[Amasawa Yuuko]]
* Other series that feature virtual reality or [[augmented reality]].

This is stylistically very different from [[mosaic censoring]], which is an automatic artist's filter.

h4. See Also

* [[censored]]
* [[reverse x-ray]]

title: terry_a_davis
body:
[b]Terrence Andrew Davis[/b] was an American programmer who created and designed the operating system [[TempleOS]].

On the evening of August 11, 2018, while walking alongside railroad tracks in The Dalles, Oregon, Davis was struck and killed by a Union Pacific train. Investigators could not determine whether his death was suicide or accidental, although the train engineer believed his death to be a suicide. The police report stated that Davis was walking with his back toward the train and that he turned around before the moment of impact.

h4. See also
* [[Linux]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Terry A. Davis":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Terry_A._Davis]

It is portrayed as a rectangular blade with a red and white color scheme, resembling a Zippo lighter.

title: hay
body:
Visually, there will likely be no difference between hay and straw on Danbooru, so no distinction is made here. In agriculture, there is a major difference between straw and hay. Straw is a by-product from harvesting crops and has little to no nutritional value. Hay is a product deliberately grown and harvested before seeding when the plants will contain a high concentration of nutrients, thus making them useful as feed for animals.

* Personal Song: "BANG×BANG"

Tōma is one of the  idols introduced in [i][[idolmaster_2|The iDOLM@STER 2]][/i]. The leader of "Jupiter", he is a year younger than [[shijou takane|Takane]]. His hobbies are soccer, cooking, and figure collecting. His character image songs, which are shared with the other two members of Jupiter, are "Alice or Guilty" and "Koi o Hajimeyou". In the anime, he slightly admires [[kisaragi chihaya|Chihaya]]'s recovery from the exposure and her singing during Idol Jam. The Idolmaster 2 hints at a potential relationship between him and [[amami haruka|Haruka]].

He and his group are signed onto 315 productions in [i][[idolmaster_side-m|iDOLM@STER Side-M]][/i], becoming one of two main idol groups for the company (the second being [[dramatic stars (idolmaster)| Dramatic Stars]]).

title: moby_dick
body:
An 1851 novel by American writer "Herman Melville":[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Herman_Melville] concerning [[Captain Ahab]]'s monomaniacal, revenge-driven hunt for a white sperm [[whale]] named [[Moby-Dick]]. Stylistically, the novel's prose entwines elements of the King James Bible, Shakespeare, and Milton. It is often praised as the "Great American Novel":[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Great_American_Novel].

Second only to its reputation as a mind-numbingly garrulous exposition of man's relationship to nature and nineteenth century whaling among American high school literature students, the novel is best remembered in the popular conscience for the climactic scene of [[Captain Ahab|Ahab]], armed with a [[harpoon]], confronting [[Moby-Dick]] as the [[ship|Pequod]] falls apart.

title: iroha_(samurai_spirits)
body:
A character from the video game series [[Samurai Spirits]].

originally from Samurai Shodown/Spirits VI, which was a non-canon dream-match game and became a very popular character, to the point that she almost got a game of her own.

She was added in the second wave of DLC fighters for the 2019 reboot, finally adding her to the universe as a proper canon character.

She is a crane who takes the form of a human Japanese [[maid]], and is known to be very loyal to her master. She fights with her two iconic butterfly swords.

title: first_ken
body:
The primary weapon in [[Cloud Strife]]'s set of interlocking [[sword]]s from the Compilation of [[Final Fantasy VII]], namely [[final_fantasy_vii_advent_children|Advent Children]].

On its own, it is a wide, double-edged sword with gaps in the middle. As part of the [[fusion swords]], the middle is collapsed, making the blade thinner.

In [[Shinzui_(fantasysky7)|]]'s [[personification]]s, the "First Ken" is differentiated by a silver/gray color scheme, jagged jacket edges, and a sparsely clothed torso.

title: rugby_ball
body:
The oval-shaped [[ball]]s used in [[rugby]].  🏉

Appearance-wise modern rugby balls are sort of a cross between a [[soccer ball]] and [[American football (object)|balls used in American football]].  They tend to be more colorful, frequently having a white base with other colors on top, while American footballs are traditionally only a solid brown.  Modern rugby balls also tend to lack the laces on the side that are a standard feature on American footballs.  Shape-wise a Rugby ball has slightly rounder ends compared to an American football.

title: yogurting
body:
A massively multiplayer online role-playing game developed by the Korean company NTIX Software, released in open beta on May 10, 2005, and in Japan on November 24, 2005. It was modern-day school life online RPG set in Estiva Academy and So-weol Academy that solved the mystery of the "Endless Vacation Phenomenon", an event that spanned the entire game that resulted in the disappearance of all teachers and schools.

This game has been discontinued. In Japan, the servers were down in May 2010. In Thailand, the servers were shut down on March 29, 2011.

body:
A type of [[makeup]] used to thicken, lengthen, or define [[eyelashes]].

Use this tag for thick or long eyelashes that are evidently from wearing mascara (i.e. the character is wearing other [[makeup]], is [[applying makeup]], or a [[mascara wand]] is visible). If the character has defined eyelashes but it's not from wearing [[makeup]], just use [[eyelashes]].

Mascara should not be confused with [[eyeliner]], which is a dark line applied along the edge of the eyelids, or [[eyeshadow]], which is a colorful powder applied around the eyes.

h4. See also

* [[eyeliner]]
* [[eyeshadow]]
* [[makeup]]
* [[runny makeup]] (for runny mascara)

title: american_football
body:
A team sport played mainly in the United States and Canada. Two teams attempt to take an oval [[American football (object)|football]] into their opponent's end zone by passing the ball, running the ball down the field, or kicking the ball through their opponent's goal posts.

Known simply as "football" in North America.

For tagging purposes this may also be used for all other Gridiron Football depictions due to their similarities in equipment.

title: kouhai-chan_(fukutchi)
body:
An [[original]] character by [[fukutchi]]. A [[petite]], very loving and affectionate girl who is dating an older male classmate of hers. She is overwhelmingly adept at [[sex]] and has an exceptionally high sex drive. As a result, many of the scenes she's involved in are befitting of the [[assertive female]] tag. Despite this, she has shown compatibility with being both dominant and submissive in the bedroom.

She has [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[black hair]] and wears a [[serafuku]] with a [[pleated skirt]].

title: mii_swordfighter
body:
A recurring original character from the [i][[Super Smash Bros.]][/i] series, making his debut in  [i]Super Smash Bros. for Nintendo 3DS and Wii U[/i]. A blue eyed, blue clad swordsman originally depicted as a basic t-shirt and jeans everyman. As of [i]Ultimate[/i] they now don a proper tunic and armor to better fit their fantasy swordsman aesthetic.

For tagging purposes, this should be referring to the character himself. For other Miis that bear swords or fit the character class, please just use [[Mii (Nintendo)]].

Known as [b]Mii Fighter (Kenjutsu Type)[/b] in Japan.

title: mii_brawler
body:
A recurring original character from the [i][[Super Smash Bros.]][/i] series, making his debut in [i]Super Smash Bros. for Nintendo 3DS and Wii U[/i]. A black-haired red-clad pugilist vaguely resembling [[Bruce Lee]]. He was originally depicted in a uniform of humble beginnings consisting of a red sweatshirt, black sweatpants, and an entirely pale and expressionless face. Since [i]Ultimate[/i], his look has been upgraded to include MMA fighting gear, exposure to sunlight, and a bad attitude.

For tagging purposes, this should be used to refer to the character himself. For other Miis that fight with their fists, please just use [[Mii (Nintendo)]].

Known as [b]Mii Fighter (Kakutou Type)[/b] in Japan.

Colette and Tim resist the ritual and find a different way to save Filgaia. Greatly resembles [[Mariel (Wild Arms)|]] and [[Florina (Wild Arms)|]].

Her older brother is Vasim, who remains in the Elw Dimension. [[Colette Mapleleaf]] and [[Florina (Wild Arms)|]]'s designs are based off of Mariel.

title: wild_arms_5
body:
The fifth installment in the [[Wild Arms]] gaming franchise, also known as Wild Arms: The Vth Vanguard. It celebrates the series' 10th anniversary with an artbook featuring characters from the five games, plus cameos of the previous games' characters in WA5.

The setting is on Filgaia, as always, but an alien race called the Veruni took over 100 years ago and dominated the human race. The main hero [[Dean Stark]] and his friend [[Rebecca Streisand]] live secluded from this life and have big dreams, but come across a golem's arm (from [[Asgard (wild arms)|]]) falling from the sky. Their adventure begins when they meet an amnesiac girl inside the arm; she only knows her name, [[Avril Vent Fleur]], and the words 'Johnny Appleseed'.

title: farmel_arianrhod
body: A member of the Brionac forces in [[Wild Arms 4]]. Farmel is known as Asgard due to her ability to erect defensive shields. While she comes off as irresponsible, she is extremely loyal to Lambda Zellweger to the point that she'll give her life for him.

title: elizabeth_(wild_arms)
body: A minor enemy who torments [[Rody Roughnight]] in his dreams disguised as Zepet Roughnight until [[Cecilia Lynne Adelhyde]] stops her. Elizabeth is a Dream Demon like [[Beatrice (Wild Arms)|]], but not much else is known about her.

title: asgard_(wild_arms)
body:
Asgard is a recurring character in the [[Wild Arms]] franchise, much like [[Luceid (wild arms)|]]. In fact, he is the only character/name who appears in every game. Asgard has different roles, depending upon which game is being discussed.

[[Wild Arms 1]]: Better known as the Earth Golem whom [[Cecilia Lynne Adelhyde]] revived. He aids her in the battle against the Metal Demons, though is mainly a defensive golem.

[[Wild Arms 2]]: Simply a force ability for [[Marivel Armitage]], who also uses another golem called Quebley.

[[Wild Arms 3]]: Is revived by the Three Prophets and fights against [[Virginia Maxwell]]'s team several times, but gains sentience along the way. Asgard is a lot more offense-based here than in his first incarnation.

[[Wild Arms 4]]: The nickname of [[Farmel Arianrhod]] due to her ability to erect defensive barriers.

[[Wild Arms 5]]: Reprises his role from the first game as a mode of transportation, and is a playable character in special instances. [[Avril Vent Fleur]] is initially discovered cradled in Asgard's hand.

[[Wild Arms XF]]: A non-sentient golem controlled by Weisheit who fights [[Clarissa Arwin]]'s party several times.

title: anastasia_valeria
body:
Anastasia Rune Valeria

The legendary Sword Magess who banished Lord Blazer many years prior to the start of [[Wild Arms 2]]. She is accompanied by the Guardian of Desire [[Luceid (wild arms)|]], and is friends with [[Marivel Armitage]]. [[Kanon (wild arms 2)|]], and the siblings [[Irving Valeria]] and [[Altaecia Valeria]] are her descendants.

title: rody_roughnight
body:
One of the three main protagonists of [[Wild Arms 1]]. He is playable in both games. He also makes a cameo in [[Wild Arms 5]]. His name in the west is Rudy, while in Japan, it is Rody. There are numerous ways to spell his name, so while none are incorrect, 'Rody Roughnight' will be used for Danbooru.

Rody starts off as an orphaned boy when he loses his grandfather Zepet. When he reveals his ability to use ARMs (Advanced Relic Machines) to save a child from a monster, Rody is exiled out of fear and he lives as an isolated Drifter. When [[Emma Hetfield]] recruits him, [[Jack Van Burace]] and [[Cecilia Lynne Adelhyde]] for a mission, his life changes as he is finally accepted for who he is. Unknown to him, he is involved in a love triangle between Cecilia and Calamity [[Jane Maxwell]] as they compete for his affections.

title: shiba_tatsuya
body: The protagonist of [[Mahouka Koukou no Rettousei]]. Tatsuya is a massively powerful magician - though he usually keeps such overwhelming strength and capabilities hidden from the public eye, only using them in limited capacities when the situation absolutely demands him to. He is somewhat stoic and quite witty at times, though his social interactions are very mechanical and he rarely if ever behaves genuinely towards someone that isn't his beloved younger sister, [[Shiba Miyuki]].

title: shiba_miyuki
body: The younger sister of [[Shiba Tatsuya]]. Miyuki is an outstanding, extremely powerful ice magician - though, by her own admission, she doesn't hold a candle to her brother. She loves Tatsuya unconditionally, sometimes going a bit overboard and overstepping the boundaries of what a "normal" relationship between siblings would be, albeit Tatsuya doesn't seem to mind it too much and will tell her explicitly when to knock it off. She has [[black hair]] in a [[hime cut]] and a snowflake-themed [[hair clip]], and light [[blue eyes]].

title: binan_koukou_chikyuu_bouei-bu_love!
body:
tr. [i]Cute High Earth Defense Club Love![/i]
A series created by [[Umatani Kurari]] about a high school club of [[magical boy|magical boys]], called the Earth Defense Club, who fight fellow pupils turned into monsters known as the Loveless. They are also put in opposition to the Earth Conquest Club, a rival group of magical boys. 

The series originated with a winter 2015 anime produced by Diomedéa. In addition, the series spawned a light novel as well as [[Binan Koukou Chikyuu Bouei-bu Love! Game!]], an otome game for mobile platforms. A second season of the anime, [i]Love Love![/i] aired in the summer of 2016, and an OVA, [i]Love! Love! Love![/i] was released in August 2017.

A sequel, [[binan koukou chikyuu bouei-bu happy kiss!|Happy Kiss!]], aired in the spring of 2018.

Pony Canyon produces a web serialized spin-off manga about the Earth Conquest Club,  [i]Binan Koukou Chikyuu Seifuku-bu Love![/i].

title: help:user_syntax
body:
When searching for users, the following variations on search parameters can be used.

h5. User ID

This is the user ID of the user for the user field being queried.

* Qualifier: [code]*_id[/code]
* Example: [code]search[creator_id][/code]

h5. User name

This is the user name of the user for the user field being queried.

* Qualifier: [code]*_name[/code]
* Example: [code]search[creator_name][/code]

h5. User chaining

See [[Help:Chaining syntax]] for details on this parameter format.
See [[API:Users]] for the list of available search terms.

h4#see-also. See also

* [[API:Users]]
* [[Help:Chaining syntax]]
* [[Help:API]]

title: help:chaining_syntax
body:
The following variations on search parameters can be used on attributes that allow search chaining.

h5. Attribute ID

This is the ID for the type of attribute being queried.

* Qualifier: [code]*_id[/code]
* Example: [code]search[artist_id][/code]

h5. Has attribute

This checks for the existence of the attribute, for such cases when the attribute is optionally included.

* Qualifier: [code]has_*[/code]
* Example: [code]search[has_tag][/code]

h5. Sub-attributes

This passes the sub search parameters to the attribute directly.

* Qualifier: [code][*][SEARCH_TERM][/code]
* Example: [code]search[creator][id][/code]

See [[Help:Hash syntax]] for more information on this URL format.

h4. See also

* [[Help:User syntax]]
* [[Help:Post syntax]]
* [[Help:Hash syntax]]
* [[Help:API]]

The supposed main character of the "Chibi Miku-san":/pools/675 4koma by [[minami_(colorful_palette)|Minami]]. And is said to be the younger sister of the original Hatsune Miku. 

She is usually energetic, hyperactive, and gets picked on by [[Kagamine Rin]], who happens to be one of her guardians while the original Miku is away.

title: yuujo
body:
Yuujo (遊女, lit. "women of pleasure"), were the [[prostitution|prostitutes]] of feudal era Japan. 

Yuujo are usually shown wearing a [[open kimono|kimono loosely hanging open]] or [[off shoulder|off their shoulders]] in order to expose their chest. Their hair tends toward extremes: either carefully sculpted shapes with the [[bangs pinned back|bangs pulled back]], or [[hair up|pinned up]] in an [[messy hair|artful mess]] (both of which are achieved through the use of several [[hair stick|hair sticks]] and [[kanzashi]]). Some form of makeup may be present, often [[eyeshadow]] or [[lipstick]]. Oftentimes, they are shown holding a [[kiseru]], an [[oil-paper umbrella]], or a rolled-up mat. Sometimes the [[obi]] will be tied in a bow on the front of their kimono, allegedly for "easy access". 

The most common depictions of yuujo are [[indoors]], [[on side|lying on their side]] in a state of seductive, carefully-arranged disarray, or waiting for clients at night on a [[bridge]] that crosses over a stream or a river.

There is a certain sub-type of yuujo, the [[oiran]], who despite also providing sexual services, were famed for being more cultured, educated, respectable, and skilled in providing classical entertainment and intelligent discourse.

h4. See also

* [[oiran]]
* [[layered kimono]]
* [[prostitution]]
* [[geisha]]

h4. External links

* "Japanese Wikipedia: 遊女":https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E9%81%8A%E5%A5%B3

title: cubism
body:
Cubism is an early-20th-century avant-garde art movement that revolutionized European painting and sculpture, and inspired related movements in music, literature and architecture. Cubism has been considered the most influential art movement of the 20th century. This tag is broadly used in association with arts in a style of those wide variety of art produced in Paris (Montmartre and Montparnasse) or near Paris (Puteaux) during the 1910s and throughout the 1920s.

h4. See Also

* "Wikipedia Entry":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cubism]

title: knees_out_of_frame
body:
Images where the subject's whole body down to and including the upper legs are in the frame, as are the character's lower legs, but the knees are mostly or entirely outside of it.

If the lower legs and feet are out of the frame as well, the image should be tagged with [[cowboy shot]] instead.

Most often occurs with characters who are [[kneeling]], [[sitting]] or [[squatting]], as these poses most often give the bend of the legs necessary for this.

body: Laevatein is an antagonist from Fire Emblem Heroes. She is a princess from the Kingdom of Múspell, Surtr's daughter and Laegjarn's younger sister.

title: surtr_(fire_emblem)

title: hrid_(fire_emblem)
body: Hríd is a Book II character from Fire Emblem Heroes. He is the first prince of the Ice Kingdom Nifl; He is the older brother of Princesses Gunnthrá, Fjorm and Ylgr, making him the eldest royalty of Nifl. He has the power to communicate with others through his dreams like the rest of his siblings; however, his power is less pronounced than than Gunnthra's and he cannot recall his dreams in great detail when he awakens.

title: ylgr_(fire_emblem)
body: Ylgr is a Book II character from Fire Emblem Heroes. She is the youngest of the Niflese royal siblings. She has the power to communicate with others through her dreams like the rest of her siblings; however, her power is less pronounced than her eldest sisters' and she cannot recall her dreams in great detail when she awakens. Naive and brimming with curiosity, she's eager to explore new horizons.

title: gunnthra_(fire_emblem)
body: Gunnthrá is a Book II character from Fire Emblem Heroes. She is the First Princess of Nifl and the younger sister of Hríd. She possesses the ability to communicate with others through her dreams as well as receive prophetic dreams. She shares this ability with her siblings. Performing the Rite of Dreams gives her more power over her dreams, allowing her to recall them in great detail even when she's awake.

title: hel_(fire_emblem)

She is often seen with a [[book]] covered in small gold chain, with some of them enwrapping Cyril herself. She also wears a [[black leotard]] and [[white footwear|white]] [[knee boots]].

title: kyojin_no_hoshi
body:
Baseball-themed manga series by Ikki Kajiwara and Noboru Kawasaki; adapted into an anime TV series in 1968, which ran for 182 episodes.

It is especially famous today for the anime's 92nd episode, "A Contract Without Compromise" (折り合わぬ契約), which originally aired on 27 December 1969. A major subplot in the episode involves main character Hoshi attempting to prove his humanity by throwing a Christmas party for his friends and rivals at his own expense; when no one shows up at the party, he destroys it in a fit of rage. This frequently-parodied scene is often associated with the line 何がクリスマスじゃあい！ (Christmas, my ass!), spoken by Hoshi's trainer Ban Chuuta in the episode.

title: gouache_(medium)
body: Similar in both theory and practice to [[watercolor (medium)|watercolor]]s, gouache has the distinction of laying opaque pigment on a substrate and using the water as a binder rather than to staining the substrate directly.  Long favoured by illustrators for its ability to cover large areas, many old [[movie poster]]s are painted with this medium.  Notably, it can also be applied via pen or airbrush.

title: yamanaka_sawako
body:
A secondary character of [[K-On!]]
The school's Wind Instruments Club adviser as well as its alumna, but eventually also the Light Music Club's adviser after being blackmailed by club president [[Tainaka Ritsu]] into the job on threat of revealing her past as "Catherine", vocalist and lead guitarist of heavy metal band "[[Death Devil]]" and also an alumna of the same club. In stark contrast to her mature and gentle facade, only to the members of the Light Music Club - whose stage name "Ho-Kago Tea Time" was of her own invention - does she show her more authentic personality: lazy, irresponsible and often putting the band in [[cosplay]] dresses, but also perceptive and an able mentor.

title: fp-45_liberator
body:
A crude single-shot [[handgun]] developed by the United States during [[World War II]]. Cheap and quick to mass-produce, it was meant to be air-dropped in large numbers to insurgents in Axis-occupied areas, for use against the occupation forces.

With its single-shot capacity, poor ergonomics, and unrifled barrel (with consequently short range and sub-par accuracy), each Liberator was expected to be used only once; it would then presumably be discarded in favor of the newly-deceased occupier's weapon.  The [[OSS]] was famously unenthusiastic about the FP-45, preferring to distribute "proper" weapons, and though many were distributed, few records exist of Liberators actually being employed in the field.

h4. See also

* [[List of weapons]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: FP-45 Liberator":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FP-45_Liberator

body:
The CheyTac Intervention is an American bolt action [[sniper rifle]] manufactured by Randy Kobzeff for long range soft target interdiction.

Physically based on the EDM Arms Windrunner, it is fed by a detachable single-stack magazine, which holds 7 rounds of specially manufactured monometal .408 CheyTac or .375 CheyTac ammunition. The entire system is designed to deliver extreme accuracy at ranges of up to 2,500 yards (2,300 m).

title: tempura
body:
A Japanese dish of deep fried battered meats, seafoods, or vegetables. The batter is a mixture of cold water and wheat flour, with a few other ingredients to the preference of the cook. The traditional mixing of the batter causes the formation of lumps which, together with the cold temperature of the mixture, would result in a crispy and fluffy texture when the food with the batter gets cooked.

title: fuantei
body:
Circle & site name: ふあん亭 (fuan-tei)
Artists: フラリ (furari) and 米泥棒 (kome dorobou)

[[Doujinshi]] circle of Furari and Kome Dorobou. They frequently pick on [[Shinki (touhou)|]].

From their answers to [[webclap]]s of January 29, 2011:

[quote]ところでフラリさんと米泥棒さんは違う人なんですか…？
え、何暗黙の了解…？いいや限界だ、聞くね！

＞背の高い方がフラリで低い方が米泥棒です。
イベントでブースに立ってる二人がそうです。
[/quote]
[quote]By the way, aren't Furari and Kome Dorobou the same person?
Oh, what? An implicit understanding? Whatever! I'm at my limit! I'm asking you! Now! (A quote from [[Kira Yoshikage]])

> The tall one is Furari and the short one is Kome Dorobou.
Two people on our booth at events are actually us.
[/quote]

title: hourai_doll
body:
One of [[Alice Margatroid]]'s [[spell card]]s in [[Perfect Cherry Blossom]] and [[Immaterial and missing Power]].

Other than sharing the same sprite with [[Shanghai Doll]], the doll has no official artwork.

Varying means of differentiating Hourai from Shanghai in fan works include depicting her wearing a [[bonnet]] instead of a [[hair bow]], wearing a [[red dress]] instead of a [[maid]] outfit, and depicting her hanged (cf. [[spell card]] name "Hanged Hourai Dolls"). Some stick to the sprite and hold it that Hourai looks completely identical to Shanghai.

Just as with Shanghai, it is a possible interpretation that Hourai is a type or class of magical dolls rather than an individual doll.

Hourai has become a relatively popular supporting character (or artifact) in Touhou fan works, even though in-game they are indistinguishable from ordinary Shanghai dolls.

[[Fujiwara no Mokou]]'s spellcard "Hourai Doll" is completely unrelated.

h4. See also

* [[Shanghai Doll]]
* [[Goliath Doll]]

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Hourai":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Hourai

title: psycho-pass
body:
A 2012 anime produced by Production I.G. and written by [[Urobuchi Gen]].

In the 22nd Century Japan, a powerful computer system called the Sibyl System guides people's lives and has eliminated virtually all crime and threat of violence by means of "Psycho-Pass" measures which reveals a person's criminal tendencies. Such a person with a high criminal tendency will be sentenced by Sibyl and apprehended, with lethal force if necessary. This is handled by the small police force under the Ministry of Health and Welfare, comprised of two groups: Enforcers (people with high crime coefficients who are deemed unable to recover) and Inspectors (normal citizens designated by Sibyl to oversee the Enforcers).
Tsunemori Akane is the young and idealistic female main character of the series, who is newly appointed as an Inspector under Nobuchika Ginoza and his team of Enforcers Kougami Shinya, Kagari Shuusei, Kunizuka Yayoi and Masaoka Tomomi. While working on various cases, the team stumbles on an out of the ordinary incident and find a trail that leads them into a deeply buried conspiracy.

h4. Characters

title: mrs._estacion
body:
A doujin game that imitates the style of [[Touhou]] without being an official Touhou Project fangame. Everything from the art style, to the gameplay design, to the music, seeks to imitate something [[ZUN (artist)|]] would have made. Even the protagonist's silly, overly-violent nature is reminiscent of the [[Touhou]] protagonists. Somewhat divergently, however, there is a male character in [[Mrs. Estacion]], and half the female cast is rather well-endowed.

title: phantasmagoria_of_dim.dream
body:
東方夢時空 ("Touhou Yumejikuu") ~ The Phantasmagoria of Dim.Dream ("Oriental Dream Dimensions")

Third game of the [[Touhou]] series, released 29 December 1997. Part of the [[Touhou (PC-98)|PC-98]] era of Touhou games.

Mysterious ruins suddenly appear near the [[Hakurei Shrine]]. The shrine's [[miko]], [[Hakurei Reimu]], together with her former enemies [[Mima (touhou)|]] and [[Kirisame Marisa (PC-98)|]], as well as a few others, stage a competition to see which one can enter the ruins, believing it holds enormous treasures.

The game is notable for its "versus" style gameplay, one which returned for the Windows generation's [[Phantasmagoria of Flower View]].

h4. Characters

title: red_queen_(sword)
body: [[nero_(devil_may_cry)|Nero]]'s sword in [[Devil May Cry 4]]. The Red Queen is a customized version of the blades used by the Order of the Sword and designed by Agnus. It has an ornately etched base, and appears to be modeled after the German Großes Messer (lit. "Great Knife"), but its most unique feature is that it has been specially customized with a motorcycle-like gear shift which, when pulled, spays a flammable propellant across the blade and opponent, greatly increasing the power of its blows.

title: godzilla:_the_planet_eater

[b]Bow down and worship the golden demise (黄金の終焉を伏して拝むがいい)[/b]
— Tagline


[b]Godzilla: The Planet Eater[/b] (ＧＯＤＺＩＬＬＡ星を喰う者 Gojira Hoshi o Kuu Mono?), is a Japanese animated tokusatsu kaiju film produced by Toho Company Ltd. and Polygon Pictures. The film was released on November 9, 2018.

It is the 34th film in the Godzilla series and acts as the sequel to the 2018's [[Godzilla: City on the Edge of Battle]]. This film is the final installment of the animated Godzilla trilogy.

title: gatakiriba_(ooo_combo)
body:
One of [[Kamen Rider OOO]]'s main combos, accessed via the Stag (Kuwagata), Mantis (Kamakiri), and Hopper (Batta) Core Medals.

This combo allows OOO to create [[clone|clones]] of himself like a real insect shedding its skin. These clones may attack their enemy at the same time.

He also gains access to the Kamakiri blades, in which mantis leg-shaped blades emerge from his forearm, and shoot [[electricity]] from the Kuwagata horns.

His Scanning Charge is the GataKiriBa Kick, where after splitting into several clones, OOO jumps into the air and performs a series of flying sidekicks on the target.

The [i]Pachydyptes ponderosus[/i] or "New Zealand Giant Penguin" is a long extinct species of penguin that lived during the late Eocene (about 35 million years ago). It had a height of around 140 to 160 cm (taller than the 120 cm tall Emperor Penguin). Being extinct, [[empty_eyes|she lacks the shine in her eyes]].

title: i_want_you
body:
"I want you for the U.S. Army nearest recruiting station"

title: necktie_grab
body:
[[Grabbing]] another person's [[necktie]] with your hand or hands. Not to be confused with [[adjusting necktie]],  this action is often done along with a firm tug in order to get a wearer's attention or draw them closer. 

This is often an expression of [[femdom|dominance]] between two characters.

title: mocha_(osu!)
body:
[i][[osu!|osu!taiko]][/i]'s official [[mascot]].

[b]Mocha[/b] is a girl of [[green hair|green]] and [[long hair|long]] hair with front [[bangs]] of a lighter shade and messy curled-up [[low twintails]].
She has [[blue eyes]] with star shaped irides.
Her official clothes are a red [[dress]] with taiko mode's icon on it and a huge light blue [[ribbon]]. Uses a [[bandaid on nose|bandaid on her nose]].

title: t-800
body:
The T-800, also known as the Terminator, is a [[cyborg]] assassin played by [[Arnold Schwarzenegger]] in the [[Terminator (series)|]] series. The T-800 is basically a robot endoskeleton combat chassis made of very strong hyperalloy, and covered with living tissue.

This character first appeared as the titular antagonist in [[The Terminator]] (1984).

h4. See also

* [[T-1000]]

title: the_terminator
body:
A 1984 [[science fiction]] action film. The first film in the [[Terminator (series)|]] franchise, directed by [[James Cameron]] and starring [[Arnold Schwarzenegger]], Michael Biehn, and Linda Hamilton.

Schwarzenegger plays the [[T-800]] Terminator, a [[cyborg]] assassin sent back in time from the year 2029 to 1984 to kill [[Sarah Connor]], played by Hamilton. Biehn plays [[Kyle Reese]], a [[soldier]] from the future sent back in time to protect Sarah.

Though not expected to be either a commercial or critical success, The Terminator topped the American box office for two weeks and helped launch the film career of James Cameron and consolidated that of Arnold Schwarzenegger. 

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: The Terminator":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Terminator]
